Topic.Title: MSFT just is about to finish off AAPL and Google is next....

Message.Msg: All the three companies you mentioned are different. Although there is some overlap, they compete in different spaces. Google is essentially a search (ad) company. It is tied to the PC but also other software and search (ad) and video gaming.

Topic.Title: PC SALES ARE DOWN BECAUSE USERS PURCHASED THE W8 UPGRADE SOFTWARE

Message.Msg: The figures speak for themselves in addition to I have researched the stores procedures for their old Win 7 machines. Microsoft Windows 8 software was up substantially. The figures are public even to bashers like you. The stores upgraded all existing Windows 7 pc's to W8 with software upgrades. I questioned: Walmart, Staples, Best Buy & Sams Club. I thought this was odd behavior because the sales of thos pc's would not be counted as Windows 8 PC's but Windows 7. I was also curious if they were doing it properly by using a separate license for each machine or taking one Windows 8 disk and upgrading them. I think that is a job for Microsoft not myself to investigate. I believe if you go into Walmart you will find that some lazy store worker used the same disk to upgrade 5-10 old W7 machines to Windows 8 upgrade packages. Microsoft may have given them permission but the same disk is a little shaky. The 2 billion investment by Value... is proof that they understand that slow PC's was simply an upgrade via software which was substantial. Perhaps you can use facts in your rebuttal rather than meaningless rants.

Message.Title: Someone is going to lose big over the long term and isn't shorts.
Message.Msg: Elsewhere in the Dow, Microsoft has soared 4% after an activist investor reportedly accumulated a $2 billion position in the company's stock. With the software giant having long struggled to navigate changing tech trends, investors have grown increasingly impatient with Microsoft's progress. Topic.Title: Tomorrow we could see another $1-2 gap up like today.

Message.Msg: SAN FRANCISCO (MarketWatch) -- Shares of Microsoft Corp. MSFT +3.48% jumped more than 4% on Monday to trade at $31 by late afternoon -- putting the stock to its highest level in at least six months. Trades on the stock began to take off in the early hours following a report by CNBC that ValueAct, an activist hedge fund, has taken a $2 billion ownership stake in the software maker. It was also the second consecutive session of gains since the company reported better-than-expected results for its third fiscal quarter last Thursday. The stock has now jumped more than 7.5% over the last two sessions since that report.

Topic.Title: sold all my msft today...

Message.Msg: The earnings will affect the price of the stock. Don't be fooled by a low PE. When earnings are declining then PE is meaningless. MSFT is a bit pricier on a valuation basis but with a virtual lock on several parts of the software market it is worth it. Also, in the end, Apple is a hardware company so valuations should be compared to a HPQ or DELL not a software company like MSFT.

Topic.Title: sold all my msft today...

Message.Msg: Excellent observation on Apple being a hardware enterprise, not software. Plus, Apple contracts out all fabrication, so it's not even a hardware company, it's a design company. That's fine if you have unique designs (iPhone 4 years ago), but Apple's design are not unique today. It takes months for Apple to make and ship a few million phones. It takes Microsoft literally two seconds to manufacture and ship a few million copies of Office. That's the difference. The economics of software manufacture vs hardware manufacture. Apple's margins are contracting. Volume is ok, but margins (profit per phone), is falling, and will continue to fall. No slam on Apple - they made billions in recent years, but the business model does have a weakness - it requires continued innovation, and great innovative products are not something you can count on producing year after year.
